source.commentary: A rendering interface that provides a handle for a Window to display. Michiel Drost - Nullpointer Works 1.0.0

method.commentary: Returns the width in pixels of the drawing canvas.
method.name: width

method.commentary: Returns the height in pixels of the drawing canvas.
method.name: height

method.commentary: Swap the content of the provided array with the content held by the drawing canvas. The swapped content will be displayed when new frames are requested. Each integer is an ARGB color at 8 bit depth.
method.name: swap

param.name: pixels
param.comment: an integer array for the same size as the rendering surface

method.commentary: Returns a java.awt.Component to which the canvas is drawing on. It can be added as a UI element to the {@code JFrame} in the window.
method.name: component

returns.comment: the component for the window to display
